IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To strengthen the higher educational resources of Texas by encouraging a program of benefactors to Tyler Junior College.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To strengthen the higher educational resources of Texas by encouraging a program of benefactors to Tyler Junior College.
IRS990.Desc: Awarded more than 1000 scholarships from permanently and temporarily restricted funds to 670 TJC students. These awards make it possible for many of the students to receive a college education which they could not otherwise afford, helping them to become leaders in their community.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Support programs and projects to promote the mission of Tyler Junior College including expenditures for art, athletics, technology, international goodwill travel, library, nursing and other academics. In addition, the foundation contributed funds for the construction of the new Robert M. Rogers Nursing and Health Science building.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NOTE 9-TAX POSITIONSAs discussed in Note 1, the Foundation is exempt from Federal Income taxes. There were no uncertain tax positions for which the Foundation believes a liability should be accrued at August 31, 2018. The years 2015 through 2017 remain open for examination by taxing authorities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CASH DONATIONS TO FUND GOLF TOURNAMENT $45024

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CASH DONATIONS TO FUND GOLF TOURNAMENT $45024

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Directors Joseph and Louise Ornelas are married to each other.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 4: Description of Significant Changes to Organizational Documents
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: On 27 Feb, 2018, the by-laws were amended to include two resolutions:Resolution defined the role of the chair of the Foundation as an ex-officio member of Foundation committees (gave chair voting rights and allowed chair to be counted in quorum for committee meetings)Resolution defined authority of investment committee so that group can hire and fire a firm that provides investment advisory and management services to the Foundation

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The IRS Form 990 is reviewed by the Chief Financial Officer for the Foundation andthe Executive Director of the Foundation. The President of the Foundation and theExecutive Committee review the form prior to submission to the IRS. The Form 990 ismade available to each voting member of the Foundation's Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation monitors enforcement of the Conflict of Interest policy on an annualbasis. All board members must sign a conflict of interest statement disclosing anypotential conflicts of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Tyler Junior College provides substantially all administrative staff and supplies to the Foundation at no cost. Cost to Tyler Junior College for staff and supplies was $838,736.
